sections.purpose: To provide a high-temperature gas flame for sterilization and heating.
sections.scope: Applicable to aseptic techniques in Microbiology.
procedure: Check the gas hose for cracks and ensure it is securely connected.
Close the air collar at the base of the burner.
Turn ON the gas supply and ignite the burner using a striker.
Adjust the air collar to achieve a non-luminous, steady blue flame.
The hottest part of the flame is the tip of the inner blue cone.
Sterilize loops or needles by heating them to redness in the flame.
Turn OFF the gas supply immediately after use.
Disconnect the hose if the burner will not be used for a long time.
Clean the burner head periodically to prevent clogging.
precautions: Ensure no flammable solvents (like ethanol) are near the open flame.
Never leave a lit Bunsen burner unattended.
Tie back long hair and avoid loose-fitting sleeves.
Be aware that the burner tube can remain hot long after the flame is out.
Always check for gas odors before igniting.
